commit_message:
Update README.md 

Added a link to BASIO paper.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:autosome-ru/pasio
paper update
Added logo to readme
Added logos to repo.
add note that default options are subject to change and for reproducibility, one should specify them explicitly
Add a note about processing data from stdin. Also emphasized that bedgraph should be sorted by contig
rename argument in open_for_read/open_for_write
bump v1.1.2
fix to make setuptools wrapper work properly
bump bugfix; v1.1.1
show short error message when program was interrupted with Ctrl+C
fix bug with incorrect logging level (handler was rejecting messages sent by logger)
version 1.1.0 bump
refine help message

* `split_bedgraph_stream` added
* `BedgraphInterval.iter_from_bedgraph` renamed into `each_in_file` and `each_in_stream`
* Now we can read from gzipped file and write to gzipped files
default logging level `INFO` --> `WARNING`; option `--quiet` converted into `--verbosity LEVEL`
fix usage string in README
--no-split-zeros and --no-split-constants were grouped into single option --split-restrictions none/zeros/constants (with constants mode by default)
input file is not an optional argument
--version option
add option --quiet
fix --output-bedgraph option
fix options spelling in readme (hyphens instead of underscores)
added note to readme about pip install
make use of git-finder instead of MANIFEST.in file and bump release v1.0.0
fix tests
use more standard option style with hyphens instead of underscores
added option --no_split_zeros as a less aggressive optimization compared to --no_split_constant

Refactor module structure:
* splitters/reducers got their own submodule `splitters`
* slice_when was moved to `utils` submodule
* intervals and sliding window are now in `dto` (data transfer objects) submodule.

Also `configure_splitter` was moved from `cli` module to `splitters.default_splitters` module
so it's easier to create splitter now.

Drop lots of stuff from autoloading when `from pasio import *` is invoked.
refactor scored and bedgraph intervals
method to split profile from an array into segments; refactor bedgraph splitting
more explicit boundaries of intervals in zip
preparations for test environment and package setup
move sources into src directory
added version
make tests import installed library, not a library from current directory
make use of import compatible with old versions of 'future' library

dirty fix for empty coverage profiles:
1) RoundReducer should run at least once
2) If for some reason logging tries to remove context that is not specified, it just skips it, not breaks
fix failure on transcript length proportional to window shift size
refactor a bit
fix __init__ module

Merge pull request #6 from VorontsovIE/fix_input

Fix bedGraph reading for supporting sparse bedgraphs files

Now gaps in data are filled with zeros by default. --split_at_gaps option overrides this behavior so that intervals diveded by gaps are splitted independently. Unfortunately, bedgraph reading became significantly slower
slice_when itertool implemented
simplify reading bedgraph by grouping intervals by chromosome using itertools (slightly slower but much simpler)
parse_bedgraph divided into two parts: extracting info by a separate iterator and coverage counts iterator
tiny optimization of reading
ignore extra columns

update README

* now CLI is invoked as a module.
* reworded description of split candidates logic

Merge pull request #4 from VorontsovIE/refactor_splits

Refactor splits
fix tests
no need to store counts in logML
separate LogMarginaLikelhood computers for integer and real alpha values. It'll bw helpful when Cython comes into play
allow real-valued alpha for just a bit more computational resources
log_calculator now calculates not log(x) but log(x+beta). So that we can use real-valued beta
Now scorer_factory is not a lambda but a class. Object of this class stores log_calculator and log_gamma_calculator (now they are instance variable, not global ones)
log/loggamma unbound calculation are now explicit, max_value have no default param
separate script into lots of little modules
refactor: extract processing single window into separate method
remove unnecessary params from SlidingWindow#windows
SplitterCombiner and ReducerCombiner merged.

scorer is now stored during splitter initialization if needed.
So we don't pass it to `split` and `reduce_candidates_list` arguments anymore.
loggers add now can contextual information (round number and sliding window)
describe novel reducer/splitter concepts
refactor: SlidingWindow- and Round- are now separate reducers

NotZero and NotConstant are called 'reducers' now. They reduce number of potential splits but
don't calculate scores and don't call base_splitter themselves.

ReducerCombiner and SplitterCombiner allow for creating sequential pipeline:
reduce->reduce->...->reduce or reduce->reduce->...->split

Note that each splitter is a reducer too (it can just throw scores away)
extract sliding logic into separate class
refactor: make use of numpy operations to convert between absolute and relative(to window start) split point coordinates

optimization: list is more efficient than array.array both in terms of memory and speed (because it doesn't need to do conversion during extending).
Alternative way was to create np.array from the beginning and to resize it to extend.
That halves peak memory consumption but makes reading almost twice slower
optimization: let temporary array obtained during chromosome reading be garbage collected before computation starts
optimization: faster mean count calculation (not to slow down during segmentation output)
use of python3 range reduces memory consumption a lot
if no_split_constant used, don't use NotZeroSplitter
simplify non-constant splitter
fix tests
refactor: split_candidates are now specified only explicitly. Note that SlidingWindowSplitter doesn't use information about split candidates
refactor: LogMarginalLikelihoods now doesn't accept default split_candidates. Be explicit.

refactor and optimize: Now round splitter finalizer segment scores are counted in split points.
To calculate segment scores and logMLs we calculate np.diff instead of slices of starts/stops positions.
Memory consumption at that stage should be reduced.
Scorer method compute_score_from_splits is removed in favor of new method scores.
log_marginal_likelyhoods is refactored to be calculated via scores.

docs: Added algorithm and implementation details to Readme.
Split points semantics is described

* Unification: now split_candidates are always numpy arrays and always contain splits which bound region of interest.
* Added assertions for `counts` and `split_candidates` correctness
* `segment_sum_logfac` is used once and with default parameters --> replaced with `total_sum_logfac`
* score with default parameters (start and stop for entire interval) is now calculated using separate functions `self_score_no_splits` and `score_no_splits`. Functions `score` and `self_score` now has no default parameters.
refactor: compute_score_from_splits is now a method of scorer
refactor tests a bit
refactor: transform collect_split_points into static method SquareSplitter.collect_split_points; some styling changes

refactor: rename variables
* constant --> segment_creation_cost
* possible_split_points --> split_candidates
* new_split_points --> new_split_candidates
* new_split_points_set --> new_split_candidates_set
* possible_split_points_in_window --> split_candidates_in_window
fix a test for log marginal likelihood
fix a test for logfactorial computations
refactor(SquareSplitter): replace enumeration with simple range by index

refactor+optimization(SquareSplitter) Extract code for split without regularizations into a separate method (short and straightforward)
No need to initialize right_borders and split_scores with zeros.
Remove manual calculations of split_scores[1]: it will be already recalculated in the main cycle
Don't take right_border from an array, as it may be slower than to take it from a variable right_borders[i]
tiny refactoring: split candidates defaults are now set in a separate method

Merge pull request #3 from VorontsovIE/logcalculator_refactor

optimize log/log-gamma calculations
unify names of log computer and loggamma computer
separate calculation of log/loggamma for values which are out of cache
log calculator and loggamma calculators now doesn't try to guess argument type (array or single number)

Merge pull request #2 from VorontsovIE/optimize_output

Optimize output by more efficient vectorized computing of log marginal likelihood before output.

Merge pull request #1 from VorontsovIE/splitpoints

Refactor RoundSplitter and NotConstantSplitter. Fix bug in RoundSplitter
calculate log marginal once for all intervals fo efficiency
don't recalculate final score twice
fix bug with splitting constant-valued contigs (which have no one split in --no_split_constant mode)
Extract method to perform single round of candidate filtering in RoundSplitter

Fix bug with last point (end+1) which is out of bounds is added into candidates
twice: into set `new_split_points_set` and later as the last point.
To solve the problem we add this point to a set and doesn't add to the
candidates list after that.
At the final stage we should remove that point because split function should
return only left boundaries; the last (right) boundary is implicit.
refactor RoundSplitter (extract temporary variables)
numpy equality comparison changed to fix deprecation warning
don't create out-of-bound candidate split-point
refactor non-constant splitter to be easily tractable
no need to make numpy array full slice
refactor: unify scorer_factory variable name along project
way --> path in help strings
Added some reasonable README.
Added licence.

Merge branch 'ilya_merge2'

Improved speed of computation by 10% by computing simplier monothonic score.
Refactored method name from basic_score to self_core.
(optimization) remove numpy type conversion to float64
remove unused methods for non-basic suffix scores calculations and for calculation of sum of all count log-factorials
(optimization) constant penalty is now added not to a vector in all_suffixes_score but in split to a number
move function which is used for test only into test_pasio.py
fix test to work with python3

Added new way of splitting without splitting constant segments.

Added --no_split_constant flag that disables split points within constant segments.
Speeds up computation by a factor of 2.6 tested on HepG2 chr17.
This is experimental features.
Refactored NonZeroSplitter to base splitter.
Refactored splitters to have one base splitter.
Style fixes.
Fixed cache reuse bug in LogGammaComputer.

Merge branch 'ilya_clasees2'

Rewriting of pasio from Ilya with more clean code and dramaticly improved performance.
Added some help message.
Fixed bug with cache reuse in log factorial.
Removed unnececcary tolerance from tests.
fix score and likelyhood computation in logger output
introduce separate functions to calculate score and to calculate log marginal likelyhood. The first one is proportional to the second one, but is faster

Drop unnecessary conditionals: first element of cumulative sum arrays is always zero (and split-candidate always contain first element) so default branch always works correct for (start=0) / (stop=0) cases.

drop implicit invocations of `__call__` method for LogMarginalLikelyhoodComputer. Now use method `score`. It will help us separate conceptions of likelyhood and score which is proportional to likelyhood but not equal
don't make expensive regularization computations for zero coefficients

By means of allowing only integer `beta` we can cache usual logarithms.
Also we use more efficent cache access when we know that array values
don't exceed cache size and fallback to an old version instead.
drop unused variable `splits_length_regularization`
don't use default value None for regularization functions. Use lambda x:x (and it is default argument value)
unify variable names in MLL calculation

optimize MLL calculation:
* drop vector slicing (and also drop buffers)
* introduce temporary variables
* reorder calculations: number-vector+number --> (number+number)-vector
replace log-factorial with log-gamma. We need to calculate gamma more often than factorial - it allows us not to subtract 1 from vector.
fix benchmarks
fix test for marginal log-likelyhood (works with Python3)
don't pass NotZeroSplitter explicitly
fix tests
refactor splitters into classes
command invokation syntax explained
fixes to paper
language fixes
make log-factorial computation faster
Added parallel wrapper to pasio.
Fixed a bug with emty interval split in rounds algorithm.
Fixed forgotten argiment in sliding window algorithm.
Introdusing length regularisation as feature.
Refactored systematic regularisation into regularization.
Added regularization on lenth of the segments.
Added regularisation for length.
Merge branch 'log_regularisation' of globe.autosome.ru:/home/dronte/projects/dream/pasio-bare into log_regularisation
In development
Added error message for required algrithm
Added a lot of formuals and a bit of text.
Added forgotten summand to formula
Fixed a bug with extra buffers size.
Added logging arguments at start.
Commit to test on real chromosome.
Added skipping zeros.
Another fix of the same bug.
Fixed a bug with column orders of last line.

Changed order of serments

So that avg counts comes the third and can be displayed in genome
browser.
Some 5-10% speed improvement using buffers.
Merge branch 'master' into speedup
Added long splitting benchmark.

Attempt to speed computation with baffers.

Needs further checks on speed.
Fixed a bug with multiple chromosomes in bedgraph.
Added start of chrom.
Added length of segment to output bedgraph.
Fixed a bug in mean counts, last line.
Added average counts column to resulting bedgraph.
Edited logging messages.
Refactored test of bedgraph parser.
Addded logging, arguments, fied bug in slidingwindow.
Added slidingwindow algorithm
Added test of score sum
Added split_candidates
Edited i to i.
Fix seed in random stress test.
Merge branch 'master' of globe.autosome.ru:/home/dronte/projects/dream/pasio-bare
Refactored scorer construction into factory.
Fixed a bug with computing logfactorial
Added regularization to splitting.
Temporary commit. Still some bugs.
continue working on
Refactored scorer construction into factory.
Cleaned code and fixed a bug
Fixed a bug with shifted log cumsum
Merge branch 'bedgraph_parser'
Added bedgraph parser
Merge branch 'v1'
Removed cubic element from log factorial computer.
Fix a bug with precomputed border
Speeded even more by vectorization.
Merge branch 'score_bugfix' into v1
Fixed a bug in score computing.
Improved speed by computing vectorly
Changed gict to array. No improvement but nicer
Improved speed even more
Fixed a bug
Speeding up using memoization of cumsums.
Refactored computation into class
Changed code to save memory.
Added benchmark. Improved speed by approximate computing of log factorial.
Added correctness deterministic test.
Added deterministic test to split function
Added first statistical test
Removed some comments.
First version including some trash
Initial commit
